title: Study based on satellite assessment finds widespread PM2.5 pollution across India

title: 'China running racket': EU attacks Beijing; rare earth curbs cause rift

Fox's move follows a distinguished career in basketball, acting, and esports, and his prior role as ambassador at large for sports.

'Will respond at right time': Taliban's warning after Pakistani air strikes kill 10
description: Overnight Pakistani air strikes in eastern Afghanistan killed 10 civilians, including nine children and one woman, prompting the Taliban to vow an "appropriate" response. The strikes in Khost, Kunar, and Paktika provinces injured four more civilians. This follows a deadly attack in Peshawar and previous cross-border clashes.

description: Director Milap Zaveri defends the shocking interval twist in 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat' where Sonam Bajwa's character offers a night with her to whoever kills Harshvardhan Rane's character. Zaveri explains it's a powerful, empowering move for the heroine, using her beauty and fame to fight an adversary, aligning with the idea that all is fair in love and war.

description: The Medical Counselling Committee has released a revised schedule for NEET PG Round 2 counselling, commencing registration on December 5th. Key dates include choice filling until December 9th and results on December 12th.  Significant changes to the seat matrix involve adding 239 PG seats at deemed universities and removing 235 DNB seats. Reporting is scheduled from December 13th to 21st.

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi ceremonially hoisted a saffron Dharma Dhwaj atop the Ram temple in Ayodhya, marking its formal construction completion. He stated that the 'pain of centuries finds rest today' and the resolve of centuries is attaining fulfillment. The flag symbolizes the renaissance of Indian civilisation and the ideals of Ram Rajya.

'Continuous acts of abuse': Celina Jaitly files domestic violence case against husband
description: Former Miss India and Miss Universe runner-up Celina Jaitly Haag has initiated legal proceedings against her husband, Peter Haag, in a Mumbai court. The complaint details allegations of domestic violence, cruelty, and manipulation. The court has issued a notice to Haag, with the next hearing scheduled for December 12. Neither Jaitly nor Haag have publicly commented on the matter.

title: ‘Violative of bodily integrity’: Chhattisgarh High Court allows minor rape survivor to terminate 21-week pregnancy
Mumbai Metro Line 3 services briefly delayed after train develops technical snag
'5th smallest on record': Is the ozone hole over Antarctica getting smaller?
description: Antarctica's ozone hole is showing significant recovery, appearing smaller and breaking up earlier this year. Scientists attribute this positive trend to global efforts under the Montreal Protocol, which has reduced ozone-depleting chemicals. While weather plays a role, the long-term outlook for the ozone layer's full recovery by the late 2060s remains promising.

title: 'I don’t care what Gautam Gambhir says': Ex-India captain explodes in fiery attack
description: Former captain Krishnamachari Srikkanth has launched a scathing attack on head coach Gautam Gambhir, criticizing India's selection policy after their struggles in the second Test against South Africa. Srikkanth questioned player omissions and the team's 'trial and error' approach, highlighting the contrast between India's batting collapse and South Africa's effective exploitation of the pitch.

title: ‘Buying veggies felt like a full academic module’: Indian student on life abroad
description: Neeharika's study abroad journey from Bengaluru to the UK reveals a profound personal transformation. She navigated initial quietude and daily challenges, learning independence through everyday tasks. University life demanded self-direction, while building a community provided crucial support. This experience underscores that growth abroad is subtle, unfolding through ordinary moments and quiet victories, ultimately proving immensely rewarding.

title: Australia’s social media crackdown: Internet’s free-range era is over — and we still don’t know who should be in charge

'Zubeen Garg murdered': Assam CM makes big claim; hints at shocking motive
description: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma declared singer Zubeen Garg's death in Singapore a "plain and simple murder" in the state Assembly. He stated one person was responsible, with others aiding them. The opposition's adjournment motion to discuss the circumstances was admitted, with a Special Investigation Team and a judicial commission probing the incident.

title: Everyone thinks AI will kill jobs, but the future McKinsey prediction is far stranger
description: AI may be reshaping workplaces, but a new McKinsey Global Institute report argues that it won’t replace the workforce—it will redefine it. While automation could theoretically cover over half of US work hours, the study highlights the enduring value of human skills and emphasizes that real gains will come from redesigning work so people and AI systems operate collaboratively.

Trump’s H-1B visa & immigration crackdown: Indians look at EB-1A visa route - all you want to know
description: Indian professionals are shifting from H-1B visas to EB-1A, seeking exceptional ability green cards due to rising fees and stricter US immigration policies. This move offers greater stability and independence from employer sponsorship, especially amid tech layoffs.  The surge in EB-1A applications highlights a preference for predictable immigration pathways.

title: Making of Smaran R: How a coach transformed a hyper-active kid into run-scoring machine
description: Karnataka middle-order batter Smaran Ravichandran is going through a purple patch. After a steady 2024-25 Ranji Trophy season with 516 runs in seven matches, the southpaw has already amassed 595 runs in five matches in the 2025-26 season. In his brief 13-match career, the Bengaluru boy has already smashed three double centuries, was the hero of Karnataka’s Vijay Hazare title triumph, and is now knocking on the selectors’ door with his consistent performances across formats.

The historic flag-hoisting ceremony, held during the auspicious Abhijit Muhurat, was witnessed by thousands of devotees and dignitaries, symbolizing a new spiritual era for Ayodhya.

The decision follows uniform legal standards applied to all similar cases. Formal procedures are underway, ensuring compliance with regulatory frameworks, while the preacher’s identity and family details remain undisclosed.

description: Stand-in captain Rishabh Pant's leadership and batting form are under intense scrutiny during the second Test against South Africa. His aggressive approach, even in difficult situations, has drawn criticism, with former spinner Ravichandran Ashwin noting a lack of positive body language. Pant's first Test captaincy outing highlights challenges in balancing risk-taking with match awareness, impacting his guidance of younger players.

6 popular 'healthy' foods that are harmful for your heart
description: Commonly perceived healthy foods like bananas, spinach, grapefruit, soy sauce, liquorice, and alcohol can pose significant heart risks, especially for individuals with existing health conditions or on specific medications. Cardiologist Dmitry Yaranov highlights how these items can disrupt electrolyte balance, interfere with drug efficacy, and directly strain the cardiovascular system, urging caution and personalized dietary awareness.

Malini recounts Dharmendra's initial charm and her eventual ultimatum, prioritizing his love over material possessions. She acknowledges their unconventional arrangement, living separately but emphasizing his consistent support for her and their daughters, stating she never wished to disrupt his existing family.

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has arrived in Ayodhya to hoist the specially crafted "Dharma Dhwaj" atop the Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Temple. This significant event, scheduled for Vivah Panchami during the auspicious Abhijit Muhurat, symbolizes the culmination of a centuries-old aspiration and a moment of immense cultural pride. The flag, engineered for durability, bears sacred symbols representing core Sanatan Dharma values.

Silent for 10,000 years… then a blast: Eyewitnesses recall Ethiopia volcano eruption — watch
description: A remote Ethiopian volcano, dormant for millennia, erupted violently, spewing ash 15km high and darkening skies.  Locals described the blast as a "bomb of smoke and ash." While no lives were lost, the eruption has severely impacted livestock-herding communities, with ash covering grazing lands and threatening livelihoods.  The event has caused widespread shock due to its unprecedented nature.

Ethiopia’s volcanic ash cloud enters Delhi: Is the city’s already ‘very poor’ air at risk? Experts weigh in
description: A volcanic ash cloud from Ethiopia's Hayli Gubbi volcano entered western India on Monday evening, moving across northern states.  While unlikely to significantly impact Delhi's air quality, the plume is traveling at high altitudes and could disrupt air traffic, causing delays. Authorities and airlines are closely monitoring the situation for safe air travel.

description: Former NBA star Jeff Teague ignited a hip-hop debate, boldly claiming Jay-Z could defeat Lil Wayne, Drake, and Nicki Minaj combined in a hypothetical Verzuz battle.  Teague argued Hov's extensive catalog and legacy are unparalleled, even dismissing a Roc-A-Fella vs. Young Money matchup as unfair. His strong stance reignited discussions on rap's hierarchy.

title: Terror lens on UP maulana: Madrassa teacher on govt payroll, preacher in UK
description: A UP government teacher, Maulana Shamsul Huda Khan, drew a salary for ten years while living in the UK and acquiring British citizenship. Four minority welfare officials were suspended for complicity in facilitating his illegal salary, leave, and retirement benefits. The crackdown uncovers a decade-long conspiracy involving foreign-funded religious operations and radicalization attempts.

title: Gemini 3.0 launch: Salesforce CEO says won't use ChatGPT again; praises Google’s AI model
description: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff declared he's switching from ChatGPT to Google's Gemini 3.0 after a two-hour trial, citing significant improvements in reasoning, speed, image, and video processing. This endorsement highlights the intense competition in the AI landscape, with even OpenAI's CEO acknowledging Google's advancements.

title: Stefon Diggs’ partner Cardi B makes gold pendant from baby’s umbilical cord
description: Cardi B commemorated her fourth child's birth by transforming her umbilical cord into a gold pendant and her placenta into vitamins. This unique practice, offered by Mommy Made Encapsulation, also includes creating a "Tree of Life" placenta print. The service aims to preserve the initial bond between parent and child, a trend embraced by other celebrities.
